page.title: 11Bredwardine: Social Life.
page.content: The Women's Institute is the only 'Club' meeting regularly in the area. It was formed 62 years ago but has only 20 members - hardly surprising in view of the low population. However it is invaluable as a link between villagers and although small is a very lively and friendly institution. Another organisation is the Wyeside Community Project Group, set up under the Community Development Scheme of the County Council. This concerns itself with initiating and promoting community efforts; an example is the recent production of a local Services Directory. There is no longer any Playgroup or Youth Club. Young people have to go out of the area for these.
